intro: Mammillaria rigidispina, commonly known as the rigid spined mammillaria, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its cylindrical stem covered in white, woolly spines and small, rounded tubercles. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and hardy nature, it is a popular choice for cactus enthusiasts.
